1.text: Brethren, I could not speak to you as to spiritual persons, but as to carnal ones—infants in Christ.

2.text: I fed you with milk and not with meat, because you were not yet ready. Indeed, you are not even ready now

3.text: because you are still carnal. As long as there is jealousy, strife, and factions among you, are you not carnal, walking according to human ways?

4.text: When one says, “I follow Paul,” and another, “I follow Apollos,” are you not carnal?

5.text: Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, if not servants through whom you believed; and each as the Lord gave to him?

6.text: I planted, Apollos watered, but [it is] God [who] made it grow!

7.text: And so, neither the one planting nor the one watering is anything: only God makes it grow.

8.text: Now the one planting and the one watering are the same, but each will receive a personal reward according to his own labor.

9.text: Indeed, we are God’s co-workers! You are God’s field, God’s building.

10.text: According to the grace of God which was given to me, as a wise master builder, I have laid a foundation, and another builds on it. But let everyone be careful how he builds on it!

11.text: As it is, no one can lay any other foundation than the one that has [already] been laid, which is Jesus Christ.

12.text: But as one builds on that foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, or stubble,

13.text: each person’s work will be revealed. Certainly, the Day will make it manifest, because it is revealed in fire; and the fire will test everyone’s work.

14.text: If what someone has built on the foundation remains, then a reward shall be received.

15.text: [On the other hand], if someone’s work is burned, it will be lost, but that person shall be saved, as through fire.

16.text: Do you not know that you are a sanctuary of God, and that God’s Spirit lives in you?

17.text: If anyone destroys God’s sanctuary, God will destroy him because God’s sanctuary is holy, and this is what you are!

18.text: Let no one deceive himself: if anyone thinks that he is wise among you in this world, let him become a fool, so that he may become wise.

19.text: Indeed, the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God! As it is written, “He has taken the wise in their craftiness.”

20.text: And also, “The Lord knows the reasoning of the wise, that it is worthless.”

21.text: Therefore, let no one boast in human beings! All things are yours,

22.text: whether Paul, or Apollos, or Kephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come. All belong to you,

23.text: and you belong to Christ, and Christ belongs to God.
